intro: Hieracium auriculiforme subsp. eginense, commonly known as the Eginense hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open grasslands. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20–40 centimeters. Its reproductive strategy involves wind pollination, with seeds dispersed by the wind, contributing to its distribution across its native range.
